page.title: 15Housing in Normanby
page.content: Travellers passing through the hamlet of Normanby see the same picture that they would have seen before the 2nd World War.Building is very carefully controlled.They have not wished to enlarge the hamlet and so there has not been any new housing built since 1936.The housing falls into 3 categories.Firstly there are Estate houses built in 1936 and built to blend into the rural landscape. Secondly there is a small 1980's development where late 19th century stables were redesigned as homes but retain their original appearance. Thirdly there are privately owned cottages built as long ago as 1805 but renovated with their external appearance controlled by means of preservation orders.
